Introduction to Corva
blocks.body: Corva is an advanced real-time monitoring and optimization platform for drilling and completions. Corva can be used to identify trends in rig performance and drive improvement by displaying the data in visually pleasing and intuitive applications within the Corva platform. Drilling optimization is also achieved by using Corva’s database of offset wells and identifying optimal drilling parameters that maximize rate of penetration. With Corva, drilling engineers can reduce drilling and slide time, identify problem events using automated alerts, and mine historical data to discover the best practices for drilling each formation and area.

blocks.heading: To access the Corva Platform navigate to [www.corva.ai](http://www.corva.ai) in your Google Chrome web-browser and click the Sign In button.
blocks.body: Email address serves as a login and password are set up by following the instructions in the Welcome Email.

Dashboard displays a list of the dashboards available on the account. The dashboards are a group of applications that display various information about the wells in Corva. Dashboards can be custom made or prebuilt with the most used applications in Corva.

blocks.heading: All wells and rigs can be found, created and edited through the Assets.
blocks.body: Assets can be searched by Wells, Rigs, Programs, and Map. When searching by wells, the search can be filtered by the Company, Date Range, and Status of the well itself. These selections are found in the far-left portion of the browser window.

blocks.heading: Corva Account Setup and Password Reset

blocks.body: To set up a customer’s account click on the Config button at the top right of the Corva application.
Once there you will notice the selections on the left hand side of the application.

blocks.heading: The Users List menu options will display a list of all the accounts created in Corva. This is searchable by company name and you can also search by typing in the name or the user.
blocks.body: To create a new account click on the Create button at the top right of the application.

blocks.body: Data Entry Requirements:

blocks.heading: As the volume of work grew for the operations at Corva this generated a massive amount of data entry for the analyst monitoring the live wells. Each day the daily drilling report is received from each active rig and from this the operations summary, 24hr forecast, costs and NPT were manually entered into each asset. Fusion can also parse fluids from mud reports.
blocks.body: From the need to more efficiently handle this volume of data entry Fusion was developed. Fusion is an application that automates some of the data entry required by scanning the Corva email inbox, identifying daily drilling reports and extracts that information to populate the assets in Corva with required information pertaining to the well.

blocks.heading: Check Operation Summaries for multiple entries
blocks.body: There should be a single operations summary entry per day for each asset. Duplicate entries should be removed

It can be both challenging and overwhelming when it comes to covering over 50 rigs drilling operations during your first hitch as a Drilling Data Analyst at Corva. The work flow is fast paced and the data must be correct when entered into the system. Corva’s rig count has grown tremendously since my very first hitch as an operations analyst and it is expected to grow continuously as the platform is expanded to cover more operations and offer additional optimization tools for drilling and completions.

blocks.heading: Drilling Data Analyst Priorities - Tips for Success in Operations

When starting your first hitch in operations keep in mind that with this volume of work there may be items that you are not able to get to. For these items be sure to make good notes on the handover sheets and discuss with your relief during tour change.
blocks.body: Also be mindful that you are not alone with your rigs. There will be other drilling data analysts and a host of operations support personnel that can help answer questions that may arise during your tour. Use the resources available to you to help you get thru your first tour if necessary.
